001import java.util.Scanner;
002import java.util.StringTokenizer;
003
004/**
005 * This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. 
006 * "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game.  
007 * 
008 * This parser reads user input and tries to interpret it as an "Adventure"
009 * command. Every time it is called it reads a line from the terminal and
010 * tries to interpret the line as a two word command. It returns the command
011 * as an object of class Command.
012 *
013 * The parser has a set of known command words. It checks user input against
014 * the known commands, and if the input is not one of the known commands, it
015 * returns a command object that is marked as an unknown command.
016 * 
017 * @author  Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes + D.Bureau
018 * @version 2008.03.30 + 2013.09.15
019 */
020public class Parser 
021{
022    private CommandWords aCommandWords;  // (voir la classe CommandWords)
023
024    /**
025     * Constructeur par defaut qui cree les 2 objets prevus pour les attributs
026     */
027    public Parser() 
028    {
029        this.aCommandWords = new CommandWords();
030 
031        // System.in designe le clavier, comme System.out designe l'ecran
032    } // Parser()
033
034    /**
035     * @return The next command from the user.
036     */
037    public Command getCommand(final String pInputLine) 
038    {
039        String vWord1;
040        String vWord2;
041
042        StringTokenizer tokenizer = new StringTokenizer( pInputLine );
043
044        if ( tokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
045            vWord1 = tokenizer.nextToken();      
046        else
047            vWord1 = null;
048
049        if ( tokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
050            vWord2 = tokenizer.nextToken();      
051        else
052            vWord2 = null;
053
054        if ( this.aCommandWords.isCommand( vWord1 ) )
055            return new Command( vWord1, vWord2 );
056        else
057            return new Command( null, vWord2 );
058        
059    } 
060    public String getCommandString() 
061    {
062        return this.aCommandWords.getCommandList();
063    } 
064} // Parser
